member.name: T:WildBlueIndustries.ICanBreak
member.summary: The ICanBreak interface is used by ModuleQualityControl to determine which part modules in the configuration support breakable part modules. All the ModuleBreakableXXX part modules in BARIS implement this interface.

member.name: M:WildBlueIndustries.ICanBreak.SubscribeToEvents(WildBlueIndustries.BaseQualityControl)
member.summary: This method asks the implementer to subscribe to any events that it needs from ModuleQualityControl.
member.param: The BaseQualityControl object that is making the request.

member.name: M:WildBlueIndustries.ICanBreak.OnPartBroken(WildBlueIndustries.BaseQualityControl)
member.summary: Asks the implementer to perform whatever actions are needed when the part is declared broken.
member.param: The BaseQualityControl object that is making the request.

member.name: M:WildBlueIndustries.ICanBreak.OnPartFixed(WildBlueIndustries.BaseQualityControl)
member.summary: Called when the part is declared fixed, this method gives implementers a chance to restore their functionality.
member.param: The BaseQualityControl object that is making the request.

member.name: M:WildBlueIndustries.ICanBreak.ModuleIsActivated
member.summary: Asks the implementer if the module is activated. Only activated modules will be considered during quality checks. The return value varies with the type of breakable part module; fuel tanks are always active, while converters, drills, and engines are only active when they are running.
member.returns: True if the module is activated, false if not.

member.name: M:WildBlueIndustries.ICanBreak.GetCheckSkill
member.summary: Asks the implementer for the trait skill used for the quality check. Examples include ScienceSkill and RepairSkill.
member.returns: A string consisting of the skill used by the part module for quality checks.

member.name: T:WildBlueIndustries.BaseQualityControl
member.summary: This is a stub class designed to create a bridge between BARIS and mods that use BARIS. It also serves as the base class for ModuleQualityControl. It is part of the BARISBridge plugin.

member.name: E:WildBlueIndustries.BaseQualityControl.onPartBroken
member.summary: Fired when the part is declared broken. Individual breakable part modules also receive this state change through the ICanBreak interface.

member.name: E:WildBlueIndustries.BaseQualityControl.onPartFixed
member.summary: FIred when the part is declared fixed. Individual breakable part modules also receive this state change through the ICanBreak interface.

member.name: E:WildBlueIndustries.BaseQualityControl.onUpdateSettings
member.summary: Fired when any of the difficulty settings have been changed.

member.name: E:WildBlueIndustries.BaseQualityControl.onMothballStateChanged
member.summary: Fired when the mothball state changes.

member.name: F:WildBlueIndustries.BaseQualityControl.qualityDisplay
member.summary: Human readable quality display. Broken (0), Poor (1-24), Fair (25-49), Good (50-74), Excellent (75-100)

member.name: F:WildBlueIndustries.BaseQualityControl.isMothballed
member.summary: Field to indicate whether or not the part is mothballed.

member.name: T:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableAsteroidDrill
member.summary: ModuleBreakableAsteroidDrill is designed to replace ModuleAsteroidDrill and interface ModuleQualityControl. When a part is declared broken, it disables the drill, and when the part is declared fixed, it re-enables it again. Almost all of the functionality is internal; all the part config designer needs to do is make sure that ModuleBreakableAsteroidDrill appears before ModuleQualityControl. In addition to the MTBF checks done over time, a quality check occurs whenever the drill is started or stopped. It is part of the BARISBridge plugin.

member.name: F:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableAsteroidDrill.runningEffect
member.summary: Name of the effect to play when the drill is running.

member.name: F:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableAsteroidDrill.isBroken
member.summary: Flag to indicate that the part module is broken. If broken, then it can't be declared broken again by the ModuleQualityControl.

member.name: F:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableAsteroidDrill.qualityCheckSkill
member.summary: What skill to use when performing the quality check. This is not always the same skill required to repair or maintain the part.

member.name: M:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableAsteroidDrill.StartConverter
member.summary: This method will start the asteroid drill. When starting, it will make a quality check. Use this method in place of StartResourceConverter.

member.name: T:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableConverter
member.summary: ModuleBreakableConverter is designed to replace ModuleResourceConverter and interface ModuleQualityControl. When a part is declared broken, it disables the harvester, and when the part is declared fixed, it re-enables it again. Almost all of the functionality is internal; all the part config designer needs to do is make sure that ModuleBreakableConverter appears before ModuleQualityControl. In addition to the MTBF checks done over time, a quality check occurs whenever the converter is started or stopped. It is part of the BARISBridge plugin.

member.name: F:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableConverter.qualityCheckSkill
member.summary: What skill to use when performing the quality check. This is not always the same skill required to repair or maintain the part.

member.name: F:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableConverter.isBroken
member.summary: Flag to indicate that the part module is broken. If broken, then it can't be declared broken again by the ModuleQualityControl.

member.name: T:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableHarvester
member.summary: ModuleBreakableHarvester is designed to replace ModuleResourceHarvester and interface ModuleQualityControl. When a part is declared broken, it disables the harvester, and when the part is declared fixed, it re-enables it again. Almost all of the functionality is internal; all the part config designer needs to do is make sure that ModuleBreakableHarvester appears before ModuleQualityControl. In addition to the MTBF checks done over time, a quality check occurs whenever the drill is started or stopped. It is part of the BARISBridge plugin.

member.name: F:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableHarvester.runningEffect
member.summary: Name of the effect to play when the drill is running.

member.name: F:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableHarvester.qualityCheckSkill
member.summary: What skill to use when performing the quality check. This is not always the same skill required to repair or maintain the part.

member.name: F:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableHarvester.isBroken
member.summary: Flag to indicate that the part module is broken. If broken, then it can't be declared broken again by the ModuleQualityControl.

member.name: M:WildBlueIndustries.ModuleBreakableHarvester.StartConverter
member.summary: This method will start the converter. When starting, it will make a quality check. Use this method in place of StartResourceConverter.
